meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Randi Kristensen Claudia Corriere Mike Drummond Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7216.

div.div: 4th regular play game that didn't have a winner.

td.p: Randi Kristensen, a professor from Washington, D.C.
Claudia Corriere, a church musician and homemaker from Kennesaw, Georgia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $29,000)
Mike Drummond, an application scientist from Columbus, Ohio (whose 1-day cash winnings total $20,801)

tr.td: CREATION STORIES
LAKES & RIVERS
OH SAY CAN YOU SEE?
WHAT SO PROUDLY WE HAILED
GALLANTLY STREAMING TV

Let\'s clear this up: a cable car runs on an underground cable; a similar vehicle using overhead wires may be called a streetcar, a tram or this, also the name of the pole that connects it to the wires')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a video of different rail vehicles on the monitor.) Let's clear this up: a cable car runs on an underground cable; a similar vehicle using overhead wires may be called a streetcar, a tram or this, also the name of the pole that connects it to the wires

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Mike] The president in question in the clue is Bill Clinton. The correct response is [*]. Let\'s see what Mike lost. $13,800. We have three players finishing with no money. And what that means, ladies and gentlemen, is that tomorrow we will have no returning champion. We will introduce three new players to Jeopardy! So, sorry, folks. See you tomorrow.)
RandiWhat is Springf
$6,000
ClaudiaWhat is Austin
$13,800
MikeWhat is Atlanta?
$13,800
Little Rock, Arkansas')
